title: The Heather-Moon
author: Williamson, C. N. (Charles Norris)
snippet: Sir S. was surprised by its loveliness, though he knew by heartBurns's poem, "The Banks of the Cree." We did not come at once to theriver; but from House o' Hill (delicious name!) we plunged into a wild,forgotten paradise. The road lay under an arbour of trees like anemerald tunnel, with a break here and there in the green wall to show ablue shimmer of mountains and hills in the distance.
